chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.
items.plainText: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.

items.text: O LORD, thou hast searched me, and known me.
items.plainText: O LORD, thou hast searched me, and known me.

items.text: Thou knowest my downsitting and mine uprising, thou understandest my thought afar off.
items.plainText: Thou knowest my downsitting and mine uprising, thou understandest my thought afar off.

items.text: Thou compassest my path and my lying down, and art acquainted with all my ways.
items.plainText: Thou compassest my path and my lying down, and art acquainted with all my ways.

items.text: For there is not a word in my tongue, but, lo, O LORD, thou knowest it altogether.
items.plainText: For there is not a word in my tongue, but, lo, O LORD, thou knowest it altogether.

items.text: Thou hast beset me behind and before, and laid thine hand upon me.
items.plainText: Thou hast beset me behind and before, and laid thine hand upon me.

items.text: Such knowledge is too wonderful for me; it is high, I cannot attain unto it.
items.plainText: Such knowledge is too wonderful for me; it is high, I cannot attain unto it.

items.text: Whither shall I go from thy spirit? or whither shall I flee from thy presence?
items.plainText: Whither shall I go from thy spirit? or whither shall I flee from thy presence?

items.text: If I ascend up into heaven, thou art there: if I make my bed in hell, behold, thou art there.
items.plainText: If I ascend up into heaven, thou art there: if I make my bed in hell, behold, thou art there.

items.text: If I take the wings of the morning, and dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea;
items.plainText: If I take the wings of the morning, and dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea;

items.text: Even there shall thy hand lead me, and thy right hand shall hold me.
items.plainText: Even there shall thy hand lead me, and thy right hand shall hold me.

items.text: If I say, Surely the darkness shall cover me; even the night shall be light about me.
items.plainText: If I say, Surely the darkness shall cover me; even the night shall be light about me.

items.text: Yea, the darkness hideth not from thee; but the night shineth as the day: the darkness and the light are both alike to thee.
items.plainText: Yea, the darkness hideth not from thee; but the night shineth as the day: the darkness and the light are both alike to thee.

items.text: For thou hast possessed my reins: thou hast covered me in my mother's womb.
items.plainText: For thou hast possessed my reins: thou hast covered me in my mother's womb.

items.text: I will praise thee; for I am fearfully and wonderfully made: marvellous are thy works; and that my soul knoweth right well.
items.plainText: I will praise thee; for I am fearfully and wonderfully made: marvellous are thy works; and that my soul knoweth right well.

items.text: My substance was not hid from thee, when I was made in secret, and curiously wrought in the lowest parts of the earth.
items.plainText: My substance was not hid from thee, when I was made in secret, and curiously wrought in the lowest parts of the earth.

items.text: Thine eyes did see my substance, yet being unperfect; and in thy book all my members were written, which in continuance were fashioned, when as yet there was none of them.
items.plainText: Thine eyes did see my substance, yet being unperfect; and in thy book all my members were written, which in continuance were fashioned, when as yet there was none of them.

items.text: How precious also are thy thoughts unto me, O God! how great is the sum of them!
items.plainText: How precious also are thy thoughts unto me, O God! how great is the sum of them!

items.text: If I should count them, they are more in number than the sand: when I awake, I am still with thee.
items.plainText: If I should count them, they are more in number than the sand: when I awake, I am still with thee.

items.text: Surely thou wilt slay the wicked, O God: depart from me therefore, ye bloody men.
items.plainText: Surely thou wilt slay the wicked, O God: depart from me therefore, ye bloody men.

items.text: For they speak against thee wickedly, and thine enemies take thy name in vain.
items.plainText: For they speak against thee wickedly, and thine enemies take thy name in vain.

items.text: Do not I hate them, O LORD, that hate thee? and am not I grieved with those that rise up against thee?
items.plainText: Do not I hate them, O LORD, that hate thee? and am not I grieved with those that rise up against thee?

items.text: I hate them with perfect hatred: I count them mine enemies.
items.plainText: I hate them with perfect hatred: I count them mine enemies.

items.text: Search me, O God, and know my heart: try me, and know my thoughts:
items.plainText: Search me, O God, and know my heart: try me, and know my thoughts:

items.text: And see if there be any wicked way in me, and lead me in the way everlasting.
items.plainText: And see if there be any wicked way in me, and lead me in the way everlasting.
